metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20673 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, asdistributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflowvulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argumentvalues") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated bynm.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-common - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-for-build - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-for-host - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-multiarch - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-source - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
libbinutils - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
libctf0 - 2.34-6ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.34-6ubuntu1.1').
